Description: Corroded copper alloy short rod with two long cones opposed on each side of a narrower central part and ending with a small sphere at each tip; possibly a model of the sceptre of Min.
Curator's comments: The Museum register indicates a general reference to the small bronze finds mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80, where the item is not clearly described.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.80, p.186, pl.28)
